title: Is the world getting ready for an AI Cold War?
description: As the US and China tighten controls and build rival AI blocs, fears grow that artificial intelligence is steering the world into a new Cold War.
content: A new kind of cold war is brewing not with nuclear warheads and ideological pamphlets, but with algorithms and data centers. As artificial intelligence rapidly reshapes everything from military strategy to economic power, a dangerous divide is emergi... [4551 chars]

title: OpenAI Wants You to Get a Certificate in ChatGPT and Find Your Next Job
description: The artificial intelligence company plans to add certifications and a jobs platform to help companies find workers "actually fluent in AI."
content:
It's not quite getting a college degree in ChatGPT, but it's close. OpenAI said this week it is launching an AI-powered jobs platform and a new certification program offered through its OpenAI Academy.

title: AMD To Offer 1 Lakh Hours Of Free Developer Cloud Access To Indian Researchers, Startups
description: Computer chip maker AMD on Friday said it will train 1 lakh graduates in artificial intelligence and graphics processing unit programming in India over the next three years.
content: "AMD...announced a major workforce development initiative to train 100,000 STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) graduates in AI and GPU programming in India over the next three years. The programme will focus on developing experti... [773 chars]

title: AI can evaluate social situations in a similar way to humans, offering new neuroscience research avenues
description: Artificial intelligence can detect and interpret social features between people from images and videos almost as reliably as humans, according to a new study from the University of Turku in Finland published in the journal Imaging Neuroscience.
content:
Artificial intelligence can detect and interpret social features between people from images and videos almost as reliably as humans, according to a new study from the University of Turku in Finland published in the journal Imaging Neuroscience.

title: AI firm plans to reconstruct 'lost' footage from Orson Welles' 'The Magnificent Ambersons'
description: Showrunner, a tech platform, plans to use artificial intelligence to reconstruct 43 minutes of excised footage from Orson Welles' "The Magnificent Ambersons."
content: Showrunner, a technology platform that dubs itself the “Netflix of AI,” plans to use artificial intelligence to reconstruct 43 minutes of excised footage from Orson Welles’ “The Magnificent Ambersons,” a sweeping family drama that was famously butche... [3854 chars]

title: AI's Role in Voter List Purification Sparks Political Controversy
description: The Chief Electoral Officer of Uttar Pradesh clarified the role of Artificial Intelligence in voter list purification amidst allegations by Samajwadi Party's Akhilesh Yadav. The confusion centers around the responsibilities of different electoral bodies in maintaining voter lists and responding to affidavit submissions.
content:
The Chief Electoral Officer of Uttar Pradesh has addressed recent claims regarding the use of Artificial Intelligence to correct voter list errors.
A statement from the CEO's office clarified that the initiative to use AI is undertaken by the State E... [308 chars]

title: Evolution expert compares AI to students copying answers from a library, calls it ‘fake intelligent'
description: Artificial intelligence may appear transformative, but evolutionary biologist David Krakauer warns it is “fake intelligent.” Speaking on Neil deGrasse Tysons StarTalk podcast, the Santa Fe Institute president likened AI to a student copying answers from a library—capable but lacking true understanding. While Silicon Valley markets AI as “intelligent,” Krakauer stresses it remains a powerful tool, not a reasoning entity, raising crucial ethical questions about overstating its intelligence.
content:

title: Warner Bros sues Midjourney for copyright infringement
description: WARNER Bros. Discovery sued the artificial intelligence (AI) photo generation company Midjourney on Thursday, saying it brazenly stole the studio’s works to generate images of Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, Bugs Bunny, Scooby-Doo and other copyrighted characters.

title: OpenAI to launch its first AI chip in 2026 with Broadcom
description: OPENAI is set to produce its first artificial intelligence (AI) chip next year in partnership with US semiconductor giant Broadcom, the Financial Times (FT) reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.
